Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of visa officer's decision to deny permanent residence application
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient evidence of farm management experience and ability to contribute to Canadian agriculture
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate eligibility under self-employed category
Credibility_Factor: Applicant's IT background, business plan, and brother's agricultural knowledge considered but deemed insufficient
Procedural_Issue: Transparency, justification, and intelligibility of decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Allegation that visa officer's decision was unreasonable
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Decision found to be procedurally fair and adequately explained
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicant's IT background, business plan, brother's agricultural knowledge
Legal_Framework: Self-employed person category under Canadian immigration law
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to refusal of permanent residence application
Legal_Rule_Source: Canadian administrative law principles on standard of review
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, personal statements, business plan
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet criteria for self-employed person category
Applicable_Process: Administrative decision-making followed by judicial review
Governing_Rule: Dunsmuir v. New Brunswick, reasonableness standard
